channel.title: Carl’s Blog
channel.description: Notes on projects, learning, and life as a CS student.

item.title: Peeking Under the Hood: Week 1 of Reverse Engineering... a.k.a. "Assembly?"
item.description: Assembly, coffee, and a g++ compiler. My first lessons in Software Reverse Engineering and, hopefully, understanding assembly language.

item.title: From Formspree to Cloud Run: Building My Portfolio Contact Backend
item.description: How I replaced Formspree with my own Spring Boot backend and deployed it on Google Cloud Run — learning about APIs, secrets, and debugging along the way.

item.title: Shipping My Portfolio: Lessons in Design, Data, and Deployment
item.description: From messy folders to real visitors, here’s what building and launching my site taught me.

item.title: Why I'm Finally Building a NAS
item.description: Canines 1, Laptop 0. I’m building a home NAS with snapshots, RAID, and an offsite backup—here’s the plan.

item.title: CS-340 Project Two: Rescue-Dog Dashboard
item.description: How I connected MongoDB, Dash, Plotly, and Leaflet to help prioritize rescue-ready dogs—plus what I learned about data-driven UI.

item.title: Meet Carl: A Little Background
item.description: A quick intro: working full-time at FedEx Express, finishing my CS degree online, and life with my wife and two very opinionated dogs—plus what this blog will cover.
